title: Handling Mr. Hyde, Bipolar Disorder, Taking on Challenges
description:
In this conversation with Ira Katz, we discuss the book Ira and his brother Stanley wrote, Handling Mr. Hyde, which detailed Stanley's long struggle with bipolar disorder.
Stanley had a beautiful mind, highly gifted intellectually, extremely disciplined and organized and excelled in all of his educational pursuits, including an undergraduate degree in engineering and pre-med and completing a medical degree specializing in physiology.
The illness did not become apparent until he was 26 and working on his residency.
The book is in 8 chapters broken down into personal experience, physiological and behavioral problems, biochemical processes, treatment, free will, personal relationships, problems with bureaucracy and finally, how society deals with mental illness.

Ira relates his deep love and high regard for his brother and looks at way in which the illness would present as an entirely different personality, or person, one who was unrecognizable - no longer Stanley, but someone else entirely, hence the title, Handling Mr. Hyde.

Ira also discusses some of his personal philosophy which trends towards the libertarian, his appreciation of Von Mises, Friederich Hayek, Fredric Bastiat.
The two blogs Ira mentioned:  
http://bionicmosquito.blogspot.com/p/the-book.html
https://www.lewrockwell.com/author/ira-katz/
